description: Borrowing from Latin superficiēs (“top, surface”), from super- (“above, over”) +‎ faciēs (“form, configuration, shape”). Doublet of surface.

definitionGroups.group: (geometry) A two-dimensional magnitude that has length and breadth; especially such a surface that forms the boundary of a solid.

entries.meaning: The area of a two-dimensional surface.
The visible, external surface of a body.
The surface (of something immaterial, especially of the mind or soul).
(law) A building intimately associated with the land on which it is built.
